p: Fresh flowers of L. mutica (5 kg) were divided into four equal amounts and steam was distilled in four stainless steel Clevenger-type apparatus for 4 h. After distillation, each organic layer was separated from the aqueous phase, dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and weighted. For each distilled fraction, yield, relative density, refractive index and specific rotation were measured. The flowers were handled and distilled in the same way described for leaves [ 17].
